intro: Hedyotis lindleyana var. glabra, commonly known as smooth mistflower, is a perennial herb native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
